Tool Call.sql_query: SELECT u.user_id, u.name, COUNT(o.order_id) FROM users u JOIN orders o ON u.user_id = o.user_id WHERE u.registration_date >= '2024-01-01' GROUP BY u.user_id, u.name HAVING COUNT(o.order_id) > 5
table_schemas: users(user_id INTEGER, name VARCHAR(100), email VARCHAR(255), registration_date DATE)
orders(order_id INTEGER, user_id INTEGER, order_date DATE, total_amount DECIMAL(10,2))
table_statistics: users: 50000 rows, avg 15 orders per user, registration_date uniform 2020-2024
orders: 750000 rows, order_date skewed toward recent months, total_amount normal distribution

estimation_errors: HAVING clause impact underestimated by database optimizer
